snippet: Japan has asked the International Civil Aviation Organization to look into whether China’s new air defense zone in the East China Sea could threaten airline flights in the area.
abstract: Japan asks United Nations agency International Civil Aviation Organization to examine whether China’s claims to airspace over East China Sea could threaten order and safety of international aviation in area.
lead_paragraph: Japan has asked the International Civil Aviation Organization to look into whether China’s new air defense zone in the East China Sea could threaten airline flights in the area.

headline.main: Japan Takes Airspace Issue to U.N. Agency
headline.print_headline: Japan Takes Airspace Issue To U.N. Agency
